word[0]: plumb the depths (of despair/misery/bad taste etc)
definition[0]: to feel an unpleasant emotion in a very extreme way, or to behave in a way that is extremely unpleasant or morally bad
example[0]: When his wife left him, Matt plumbed the very depths of despair.
example[1]: That night they plumbed the depths of treachery and horror, and murdered the king as he slept.
